title: Linear Algebra - HARD Level
description: ðŸ¤¯ Ready for the ultimate challenge? This quiz tests your knowledge of **matrix decomposition** $\lambda$, **vector spaces** $\mathbb{V}$, **basis/dimension**, and **linear transformations** $T$. Master the core of advanced LA! (20 Questions - 50 Minutes)

questions.text: Which decomposition is used to factor a matrix into lower and upper triangular matrices?
The rank of a matrix is defined as?

options.c: Number of linearly independent rows or columns

questions.text: A linear transformation preserves which property?
The **Kernel** (or Null Space) of a linear transformation $T: V \rightarrow W$ is defined as...

options.a: The set of all vectors $\mathbf{v} \in V$ that are non-zero.
options.b: The set of all vectors $\mathbf{w} \in W$ that are mapped to.
options.c: The set of all vectors $\mathbf{w} \in W$ such that $T(\mathbf{v}) = \mathbf{w}$.
options.d: The set of all vectors $\mathbf{v} \in V$ such that $T(\mathbf{v}) = \mathbf{0}_W$

questions.text: According to the **Rank-Nullity Theorem**, for a matrix $A$ with $n$ columns, $\text{rank}(A) + \text{nullity}(A)$ is equal to...
A set of vectors $B = \{\mathbf{v}_1, \ldots, \mathbf{v}_n\}$ is a **basis** for a vector space $V$ if...

options.d: The size of $B$ is greater than the dimension of $V$

questions.text: Which matrix decomposition is fundamentally used to solve the **least squares** problem?
If $A$ is a real **symmetric** matrix, which property is always true about its eigenvectors?

options.d: Eigenvectors corresponding to distinct eigenvalues are orthogonal

questions.text: The **dimension** of a vector space is defined as...

options.a: The number of vectors in any basis for the space
options.b: The number of rows in any matrix representing the space
options.c: The largest number of linearly dependent vectors in the space
options.d: The total number of elements in all vectors

questions.text: Which decomposition factors a matrix $A$ into $U\Sigma V^T$, where $U$ and $V$ are orthogonal matrices and $\Sigma$ is a diagonal matrix?
In a linear transformation $T(\mathbf{x}) = A\mathbf{x}$, the column space of $A$ is equivalent to the transformation's...
The **Change of Basis** matrix $P_{B \leftarrow C}$ transforms coordinates from basis $C$ to basis $B$. What is $P_{C \leftarrow B}$?
The **spectral theorem** applies to which type of matrix?
What must be true for a **Cholesky decomposition** ($A = LL^T$) to exist?

options.b: $A$ must be symmetric and positive definite
options.c: $A$ must have all $1$s on the diagonal

questions.text: The **Nullity** of a matrix $A$ is the dimension of which space?
The **condition number** of a matrix $A$ is a measure of its sensitivity to...

options.c: The time it takes to compute the inverse

questions.text: If $W$ is a subspace of $\mathbb{R}^n$, the set $W^{\perp}$ (W-perp) is called the **orthogonal complement**. What is its relationship with $W$?

options.c: They must have the same dimension

questions.text: Which method uses Householder reflections or Givens rotations?
What does it mean for a square matrix $A$ to be **diagonalizable**?

options.c: $A$ is similar to a diagonal matrix $D$ ($A = PDP^{-1}$)

questions.text: If $T$ is a linear transformation from $\mathbb{R}^3$ to $\mathbb{R}^2$, what is the maximum possible rank of $T$?
